name: GIST Stomach N
title: Clinical N
notes:
**Note 1:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis.

**Note 2:**  Hepatoduodenal nodes are regional for primaries of the lesser curvature of the stomach.  They are coded in distant metastasis for all other subsites in this schema.

**Note 3:**  Regional lymph node involvement is rare for GISTs, so that cases in which the nodal status is not associated clinically or pathologically could be considered N0 instead of cNX or pNX.

**Regional lymph nodes for Stomach are:**

    Celiac:
       Hepatic (excluding gastrohepatic) 
       Hepatoduodenal     
    Left gastric (superior gastric), NOS:
       Cardial
       Cardioesophageal
       Gastric, left
       Gastropancreatic, left
       Lesser curvature
       Lesser omental
       Paracardial
    Hepatoduodenal (for lesser curvature)  
    Nodule(s) in perigastric fat    
    Pancreaticosplenic (pancreaticolienal)
    Pancreaticoduodenal
    Perigastric, NOS
    Peripancreatic
    Right gastric (inferior gastric), NOS:
       Gastrocolic
       Gastroduodenal
       Gastroepiploic (gastro-omental), right or NOS
       Gastrohepatic
       Greater curvature
       Greater omental
       Pyloric, NOS: infrapyloric, subpyloric, suprapyloric
    Splenic (lienal), NOS:
        Gastroepiploic (gastro-omental), left
        Splenic hilar
footnotes: *NX is not defined in AJCC 7th edition
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed*

Unknown; regional lymph nodes not stated
